short_summary: Expansion of the staff parking lot located in Selkirk, MB.
description: This project is for the expansion of the staff parking lot located in Selkirk, MB. The project includes site preparation, minor excavation, packed gravel, concrete, curbs, and electrical work for necessary outlets and lighting. The Contractor must complete the work by November 30th, 2023.
full_summary:
# Parking Lot Expansion Project - Selkirk, MB

## Invitation to Qualify

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites you to submit a Request for Qualification (RFQ) for the Parking Lot Expansion Project in Selkirk, Manitoba. 

### Project Overview

This project involves the expansion of the staff parking lot located in Selkirk, MB. The scope of work includes site preparation, minor excavation, compacted gravel, concrete, curbs, and electrical installations for required outlets and lighting.

### Mandatory Pre-Qualification Requirements

To be considered for this project, bidders must meet the mandatory requirements outlined in the RFQ document. The pre-qualification phase will assess the bidder's suitability to proceed with the project.

### Key Project Dates

* Pre-Qualification Phase: Project number: M5000-22-5032/A
* Tender Closing Date: July 21, 2023, 4:00 PM (MDT)
* Expected Contract Start Date: August 1, 2023

### Selection Criteria

The selection criteria are based on the bidder's ability to meet the project's technical, safety, and quality requirements.

### Approvisionnement autochtone

Indigenous Procurement: The RCMP encourages First Nations, Inuit, and Métis businesses to participate in this project. A Business Profile in the Indigenous Business Directory can increase your company's visibility and may provide additional business opportunities.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact:

* Sandra E. Robinson
* Email: [sandra.robinson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:sandra.robinson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (780) 670-8626
* Fax: (780) 454-4523

This is a competitive procurement, with the contract award based on the bidder's qualifications, technical capabilities, and proposal. The RCMP reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

All documents, including the RFQ, can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website at [http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders). It is the bidder's responsibility to regularly consult the GETS website for updates. Canada is not responsible for any information found on third-party websites. Note that any amendments, including significant enquiries received and their replies, will be posted on the GETS website. The bidder is responsible for ensuring they have the most up-to-date
